results.title: Disappeared racecourses of north west Victoria
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the 6 works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region.
Ian Fisher was a champion jockey in north west Victoria in the 1930s and ‘40s. In this film he and his brother Trenfield recall the tracks they raced on across this region, most of which have now disappeared. Standing on the site of the old Rainbow racecourse, Ian tells the story of winning the Rainbow Cup in 1937 and remembers the people who “made racing” in that era.

results.title: Disability awareness
results.creator_credit: Louise Welsh Schrank and Stage Fright Geneva, Il
results.brief_description: When you encounter someone who is physically or mentally handicapped how do you react? Pity? Discomfort? Either reaction will influence your ability to communicate. This program is essentially about improving communication and relationships with the disabled. Good guidance (“enabling tips”) is given by a deaf woman, a boy whose wheelchair is an extension of his body, and a girl blind from birth. The benefits of integration (mainstreaming) and ‘coaching’ are explored as we learn about the school lives of a child with Down’s Syndrome, a boy with cerebral palsy and the blind girl. The power and importance of non-judgemental language is also covered.

results.title: Dis-Moi Que Tu M'aimes = Tell Me You Love Me
results.creator_credit: Michel Boisrond, Francis Cosne and Gerard Beytout
results.brief_description:
Bertrand and Richard both work in an advertising agency. Richard is married to sweet and submissive Charlotte, whom he treats harshly. Victoire, Bertrand’s wife is less than impressed by this display of chauvinism. Both couple decide to experiment with temporary separation. The men setup camp at the office and the women share a house.

Credits: Producers, Gerard Beytout, Francis Cosne ; director, Michel Boisrond ; writers, Michel Boisrond, Annette Wademant ; photography, Daniel Gaudry ; music, Claude Bolling.
Cast: Mireille Darc, Daniel Ceccaldi, Marie-Jose Nat, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Jean-Pierre Darras.

results.title: Dirty rotten scoundrels (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, Bernard Williams and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: In Beaumont-sur-mer on the French Riviera, Lawrence Jamison (Michael Caine), a suave stylish con man who is an expert at extracting jewels from rich, married women must find a way to deal with crass new competition in the person of Freddy Benson (Steve Martin), a small time scam artist who tells tragic tales about his grandma to secure a few francs from almost anyone! Eventually they decide to compete and make a wager that whoever cannot swindle a certain naive soap heiress (Glenne Headly) for $50,000 must leave the French Riviera hunting ground. A remake of the 1964 “Bedtime stories”.

results.title: Dirty pretty things
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Robert Jones, Tracey Seaward, BBC Film Unit and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: An illegal immigrant in urban London, Okwe, is working as a cab driver and doing the nightshift as a hotel receptionist (Chiwetel Ejiofor). He is sharing a flat with one of the hotel’s maids, Senay, (Audrey Tautou’s first English speaking role) who is also an illegal but dreams of escaping to live in America. Initially the film is more a character study of the pair always living in fear of deportation and struggling with poverty but soon develops into a thriller as one night, a gruesome discovery in room 510’s blocked toilet, leads to blackmail and involvement with London’s sordid underworld. Cast includes Sergi Lopez, Benedict Wong and Sophie Okonedo.

results.brief_description: Anthology series in which each season is based on a true crime story featuring an epic tale of love gone wrong.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

results.title: Dirty Harry
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Warner Bros Pictures and Malpaso Company
results.brief_description: Harry Callaghan is a tough, streetwise San Francisco cop whom they call Dirty Harry. In this classic film, you will see why. You will also see why Clint Eastwood’s reputation is secure. No other actor can match his presence. He is magnetising in his portrayal as the shoot-first-ask-questions-later law enforcer who must hunt a psychotic roof-top killer who has slain two people and has kidnapped a girl and threatens to suffocate her if his ransom demands are not met. Harry will get him… one way or the other… no matter what the “system” prescribes. Moody cinematography and stunning location filming propel the story and capitalise upon Eastwood’s commanding presence. Watch this film and ask yourself: Do you feel lucky?

results.title: Dirty Harry
results.brief_description:
‘Harry She’llberight’ is a lazy farmer, stuck in the ‘old ways’ of chemical spraying. He provides a ‘worst case scenario’ of chemical spray use. A representative of the Vistorian Department of Agriculture assists Harry in modern spraying techniques, equipment and safety. Along the way we are introduced to different spray epuipment and how it operates away from Harry’s farm.

Harry is a comical character and he eventually gets his act together as the film progresses.

Opening contains nice shots of people picking lettuce and scens inside of a vegetable market.

Good cartoon-like illustrations about chemical spraying safety.
